A card's color identity is determined by its mana cost and rules text; every card in your deck may only use mana symbols that also appear on your commander's card. Colorless cards are allowed.

Your deck must have a legendary creature as its commander and consist of 100 singleton cards built around its color identity; players start with 40 life and lose if they take 21 combat damage from a single commander.

If a commander has partner, you may have two commanders; the combined color identities determine deck legality and each commander tracks commander tax separately. Choose a Background allows a legendary enchantment to be your second commander.

column1: Legendary Vehicles and Spacecraft as Commander
column4: Starting with Edge of Eternities, legendary Vehicles and legendary Spacecraft with printed power and toughness may be chosen as your deck's commander, following usual color identity restrictions.

Brawl decks contain a legendary creature or planeswalker as commander and 99 other cards sharing its color identity. Only one copy of any card (except basics) is allowed, starting life total is 25, and decks do not have a sideboard.
Enables powerful Azorius Omniscience combo; four-mana reanimation spells proved too cheap, making decks too consistent and warping the metagame.
Power-level outlier that dominates Standard and Modern; resilient, hard to interact with, and leaves a board presence behind.
Makes red aggro decks too explosive and resilient; synergizes with Manifold Mouse to push formats toward one-turn interactions.
One-mana discard enabler used in self-bounce loops; forces opponents to discard repeatedly and reduces fun.
No official reason given; banned in Arena Best-of-One due to high win rates and unfun play patterns.
Efficient combat trick enabling explosive starts for red aggro decks; reduces the effectiveness of blocking and lowers the fundamental turn of the format.
Interacts with any permanent-based strategy and combines with Stormchaser's Talent for potential lockouts, creating unfun games.
Best-in-class card advantage engine that's difficult to interact with; encourages monotony and eliminates other strategies.
No official reason provided; likely banned due to power-level concerns or combo potential.
Artifact land producing fast mana; part of the Affinity strategy and too efficient.
Generates excessive card draw and color fixing, homogenizing decks.
Enables tutor-based creature combo decks that become too consistent.
Powerful combo enabler allowing turn‑two kills with infectious creatures.
Graveyard combo piece enabling degenerate Dredge strategies.
Fast mana producing card that accelerates decks beyond intended speed.
Land that scales mana exponentially, enabling Eldrazi strategies and huge spells too early.
Combo land that produces a 20/20 indestructible token quickly.
Too efficient mana dork and graveyard hate combined, dominating multiple archetypes.
Powerful card selection with delve making it too efficient for Modern.
Enables explosive Dredge kills by returning large creatures for free.
Allows Eldrazi decks to cast creatures too cheaply and tutor for them.
Generates large numbers of Zombie tokens; difficult to interact with and homogenizing.
Efficient free removal spell that unbalances creature matchups.
Free card that grants perfect information and filters through deck.
Combo engine for Elf decks drawing entire library.
Dredge card enabling overwhelming graveyard recursion.
Artifact land producing fast mana for Affinity decks.
Evocation free discard spell that can strip multiple cards early.
Free 8/8 creature enabling broken graveyard decks.
Cascade‑combo enabling cheating of massive permanents into play.
Banned in December 2024 for Modern due to being easily accessible companion that offers free mana; homogenizes deck construction.
Infinite mana combo engine with artifact sacrifice loops.
Companion enabling free recursion loops that homogenized Modern.
Too efficient counterspell that invalidates low-cost spells.
Combo piece with Karn, the Great Creator to lock opponents out of the game.
Fetchable island that loops powerful spells repeatedly.
Creates non-deterministic combo loops and generates excessive value.
Planeswalker too powerful and versatile; homogenizes metagame.
Free spell for digging for creatures or lands; reduces variance.
Powerful card selection spell enabling combo consistency.
Repeatable removal engine with Grove of the Burnwillows; oppressive to creature decks.
Fast ritual spell enabling early combos.
Artifact land producing fast mana for Affinity decks.
Combo piece for Eggs deck that draws entire deck.
Ritual enabling early explosive combos and spells.
Slow card manipulation engine that creates long turns and time issues.
Free mana creature enabling early combos.
Card draw engine that can draw entire deck with token generators.
Ramp spell enabling Amulet Bloom combo to win early.
Powerful card draw and protection engine that warps games.
Cascade counterspell that turns any spell into a random large threat; breaks format.
Delve draw spell providing too much card advantage for little mana.
Artifact land producing fast mana for Affinity decks.
Equipment that dominates combat and provides removal and life gain.
Combines with Grinding Station and zero-mana artifacts to create explosive and resilient combo decks that end games quickly.
Powerful card advantage engine that draws cards from high-cost spells, reducing interaction.
Generates life, card advantage, and ramp; ubiquitous and too strong.
Artifact land producing fast mana for Affinity decks.
Cascade enabler for Living End and Crashing Footfalls; too efficient.
Companion enabling 80-card decks; card advantage with flicker loops; oppressive.
